channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us

item.title: National Guard, police confront hundreds of juveniles amid Halloween chaos in DC’s Navy Yard
item.description: A video captured chaotic scenes unfolding in Washington, D.C.'s Navy Yard neighborhood on Halloween night as police took five people into custody.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Hegseth declines to discuss possible US strikes in Venezuela, blames Dems on troop pay amid shutdown
item.description: Secretary of War Pete Hegseth declined to say whether the U.S. is preparing military strikes on Venezuela, while blasting Democrats over the shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Israel says the latest remains returned from Gaza are not bodies of hostages
item.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — The remains of three people Hamas handed over to the Red Cross in Gaza do not belong to any hostages, Israel said Saturday, in the latest setback to the U.S.-brokered ceasefire in the Israel-Hamas war.
item.dc:creator: RENATA BRITO, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: Two new suspects handed preliminary charges in Louvre jewels heist case, Paris prosecutor says
item.description: PARIS (AP) — The Paris prosecutor said Saturday two new suspects were handed preliminary charges for their alleged involvement in the crown jewels heist at the Louvre museum.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, KREX 5

item.title: Ukraine says it hit a key fuel pipeline near Moscow that supplies Russian forces
item.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Ukrainian forces hit an important fuel pipeline in the Moscow region that supplies the Russian army, Ukraine's military intelligence said Saturday, as Russia kept up a sustained campaign of massive drone and missile attacks on Ukraine’s energy infrastructure.
item.dc:creator: SAMYA KULLAB, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: University of Pennsylvania investigating vulgar emails sent from school account blasting 'woke' institution
item.description: University of Pennsylvania hit by fake email attack with vulgar messages sent to campus community. School confirms its security team is investigating.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: GOP lawmakers question 'long-term fairness' of trade boost to Argentinian beef
item.description: A letter sent by over a dozen GOP lawmakers questions the "long-term fairness by the Trump administration to allow Argentina to quadruple its exports of beef to the United States at a time when Texas and other U.S. cattle ranchers are struggling, Border Report has learned.
item.dc:creator: Sandra Sanchez, WFLA, NBC

item.title: New multistate lottery game expected in 2026 could make you a millionaire
item.description: Sure, winning a record-breaking Powerball jackpot may be cool, but what about $1 million a year for the rest of your life?
item.dc:creator: Addy Bink, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: FBI raid at Idaho horse track shows how immigration is a top focus across law enforcement
item.description: BOISE, Idaho (AP) — The first sign something was amiss was the thwack of helicopter rotors overhead, followed by screams.
item.dc:creator: REBECCA BOONE, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: How does 'doomscrolling' actually affect us? Experts weigh in
item.description: While it may feel relaxing to put one's mind on pause and endless scroll the feed of a favorite app, experts are urging people to beware of certain warning signs.
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Tanner, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Supplements sold at Sam's Club nationwide linked to salmonella outbreak: FDA
item.description: Illnesses connected to using the product have been reported in Kansas, Florida, South Carolina, North Carolina, Virginia, New York and Michigan. Three people who contracted salmonella were hospitalized, according to the CDC.
item.dc:creator: Kyler Swaim, WFLA, NBC

item.title: US national intelligence director says former American strategy of 'regime change' is over
item.description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — The U.S. national intelligence director told officials Friday in the Mideast that America’s former strategy of “regime change or nation building” had ended under President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: JON GAMBRELL, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: New York Attorney General Letitia James seeks to block Trump administration's subpoenas
item.description: New York Attorney General Letitia James is challenging the legitimacy of the acting U.S. attorney in Albany as she pushes back against the Trump administration's investigation of cases she brought against the president and the National Rifle Association, according to court documents unsealed Friday.
item.dc:creator: CAROLYN THOMPSON, Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: FBI says shooter in deadly Michigan church attack was motivated by hatred toward the Mormon faith
item.description: LANSING, Mich. (AP) — The former Marine who opened fire in a Michigan church and set it ablaze last month was motivated by “anti-religious beliefs” against The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, the FBI confirmed Friday.
item.dc:creator: ISABELLA VOLMERT and HANNAH SCHOENBAUM, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Disney pulls ABC, ESPN and other content from YouTube TV amid breakdown in talks
item.description: YouTube TV viewers can no longer see Disney channels, including ABC and ESPN, after the two sides failed to agree on a new content distribution deal.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: LA fire crews told to abandon smoldering blaze that reignited as Palisades Fire: Report
item.description: That blaze grew into the Palisades Fire, which killed 12 people and devastated the Pacific Palisades.
item.dc:creator: Cameron Kiszla, NewsNation

item.title: Controversy over Tucker Carlson interview reveals conservative movement's conflict over antisemitism
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — As Republicans accuse Democrats of tolerating antisemitism in their party, the GOP on Friday was roiled by its own schism after the leader of a powerful right-wing think tank defended prominent conservative commentator Tucker Carlson for his friendly podcast interview with a far-righ
item.dc:creator: NICHOLAS RICCARDI, JILL COLVIN and THOMAS BEAUMONT, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Police investigating break-in at home reported to belong to NBA star Shai Gilgeous-Alexander
item.description: Police on Friday were investigating a burglary at a home reported to belong to the Oklahoma City Thunder’s Shai Gilgeous-Alexander that happened while the NBA's reigning MVP was playing a game the night before.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Multiple people have been arrested in Michigan in a Halloween weekend attack plot, FBI director says
item.description: DEARBORN, Mich. (AP) — Multiple people who had been allegedly plotting a violent attack over the Halloween weekend were arrested Friday in Michigan, FBI Director Kash Patel said in a social media post. The law enforcement effort was focused on suburban Detroit.
item.dc:creator: MIKE HOUSEHOLDER and ERIC TUCKER, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: FDA restricts use of kids' fluoride supplements citing emerging health risks
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Food and Drug Administration on Friday moved to limit the use of fluoride supplements used to strengthen children's teeth, the latest action by Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and his deputies against a chemical that is a mainstay of dental care.
item.dc:creator: MATTHEW PERRONE, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Ramen instead of Reese's? Looming SNAP cuts change what's on offer for Halloween trick-or-treaters
item.description: When KC Neufeld announced on her Denver neighborhood’s Facebook page that her family would be handing out ramen and packs of macaroni and cheese in addition to candy this Halloween, she wasn't expecting much of a response.
item.dc:creator: HALLIE GOLDEN, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs transferred to New Jersey prison to serve 4-year prostitution-related sentence
item.description: Sean “Diddy” Combs has been transferred to a prison in New Jersey to serve out the remainder of his four-year prison sentence on prostitution-related charges.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Court says Border Patrol official won't have to brief judge on Chicago-area immigration sweeps
item.description: CHICAGO (AP) — An appeals court ruled in favor of the Trump administration Friday and stopped a judge from trying to get daily updates from a Border Patrol official about the government's immigration crackdown in the Chicago area. The court said the order from U.S.
item.dc:creator: CHRISTINE FERNANDO, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: DC Mayor Bowser says residents will receive SNAP, WIC benefits in November
item.description: Washington, D.C., Mayor Muriel Bowser (D) on Thursday said the city will fund the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) and the separate program for Women, Infants, and Children (WIC) for the month of November amid the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Ashleigh Fields, WGN 9

item.title: Cannabis use may boost tobacco addiction risk in young Americans, study finds
item.description: New research from UC San Diego found that cannabis use among youth may be responsible for 13% of new cases of regular tobacco use in the US, suggesting that cannabis use should be considered a major risk factor for later tobacco addiction.
item.dc:creator: Amber Coakley, KRON4

item.title: Melissa expected to become an extratropical cyclone today: NHC
item.description: TAMPA, Fla. (WFLA)— Hurricane Melissa is expected to become an extratropical cyclone later today as it quickly moves away from Bermuda. According to the National Hurricane Center, Melissa is located about 255 miles north of Bermuda and is moving toward the northeast at about 41 mph.
item.dc:creator: Ashley Suter, WFLA, NBC

item.title: 2 die in flooded New York City basements during heavy rainstorm
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Two people died in flooded New York City basements Thursday during a rainstorm that shut down roadways and caused airport delays, authorities said.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Cop's testimony, judge's instructions influenced outcome of Sonya Massey murder case
item.description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill. (AP) — The killing of Sonya Massey in her home by an Illinois sheriff's deputy was pursued by prosecutors as a first-degree murder case with a possible life prison sentence. Then the judge gave the jury another option when deliberations began this week.
item.dc:creator: JOHN O'CONNOR and ED WHITE, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: King Charles III strips Prince Andrew of titles and evicts him from royal residence
item.description: King Charles III is stripping his brother Prince Andrew of his remaining titles and evicting him from his royal residence, Buckingham Palace said Thursday.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, KRON4

item.title: Teacher who was shot by 6-year-old student at school testifies she thought she had died
item.description: A former Virginia teacher who was shot by a 6-year-old student in her classroom in 2023 testified Thursday that she thought she had died that day.
item.dc:creator: JOHN RABY, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Judge considers demand to force government to keep funding SNAP food aid despite shutdown
item.description: A federal judge in Boston on Thursday challenged the Trump administration's argument that SNAP benefits could be suspended for the first time in the food aid program's history because of the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Pentagon orders 'quick reaction force' of 500 troops per state: Reports
item.description: The National Guard is building a “quick reaction force” (QRF) of some 23,500 troops trained in crowd control and civil disturbance that can be ready to deploy to U.S. cities by early next year, according to a leaked memo reported by multiple outlets Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: Ellen Mitchell, Fox 5

item.title: Rappeller dies in Zion National Park's Pine Creek Canyon
item.description: A 58-year-old man died at the last rappel of Zion National Park's Pine Creek Canyon on Sunday afternoon.
item.dc:creator: Ava Hart, Fox 5
